description: Just Another Team's recommendations for Season 13. Recommended for Mouse and Keyboard.
name: Just Another Team's MnK rolls - Season 13

data.description: Surplus + Frenzy combo buff handling, reload, stability (10/20/50) and damage, handing, reload respectively (20% buff, 30 stat points. This means you can get up to 80 stat points to handling and reload and 50 to stability.

Surplus + Frenzy combo buff handling, reload, stability (10/20/50) and damage, handing, reload respectively (20% buff, 30 stat points. This means you can get up to 80 stat points to handling and reload and 50 to stability. Overflow and MKC have very poor synergy with each other, with MKC unable to be procced while overflow is active. While these are both excellent perks, the combo is not worth keeping.

Surplus + Frenzy combo buff handling, reload, stability (10/20/50) and damage, handing, reload respectively (20% buff, 30 stat points. This means you can get up to 80 stat points to handling and reload and 50 to stability. Overflow and MKC have very poor synergy with each other, with MKC unable to be procced while overflow is active. While these are both excellent perks, the combo is not worth keeping.

Overflow and MKC have very poor synergy with each other, with MKC unable to be procced while overflow is active. While these are both excellent perks, the combo is not worth keeping.

Surplus + Frenzy combo buff handling, reload, stability (10/20/50) and damage, handing, reload respectively (20% buff, 30 stat points. This means you can get up to 80 stat points to handling and reload and 50 to stability. Overflow and MKC have very poor synergy with each other, with MKC unable to be procced while overflow is active. While these are both excellent perks, the combo is not worth keeping.

This sniper used to be excellent with Quickdraw, but with the changes removing the ads speed from Quickdraw it needs to be replaced. Surplus gives a handling increase, but it’s not the same as the old Quickdraw. If you’re getting your handling from other places, then Slideshot is best in slot for the range increase.

This sniper used to be excellent with Quickdraw, but with the changes removing the ads speed from Quickdraw it needs to be replaced. Surplus gives a handling increase, but it’s not the same as the old Quickdraw. If you’re getting your handling from other places, then Slideshot is best in slot for the range increase.

This sniper used to be excellent with Quickdraw, but with the changes removing the ads speed from Quickdraw it needs to be replaced. Surplus gives a handling increase, but it’s not the same as the old Quickdraw. If you’re getting your handling from other places, then Slideshot is best in slot for the range increase.

Frenzy and Vorpal now give the same damage bonus (15%), so it’s your choice which perk. Vorpal affects majors [champs] and bosses, Frenzy affects all enemies and gives a +50 stat bonus to reload speed but takes some time to proc.

Frenzy and Vorpal now give the same damage bonus (15%), so it’s your choice which perk. Vorpal affects majors [champs] and bosses, Frenzy affects all enemies and gives a +50 stat bonus to reload speed but takes some time to proc.

This sniper has some interesting rolls. With KC and MKC it can get ohk body shots, and Vorpal makes it one of the ways to counter a behemoth super. However, these all roll in the same slot as the handling perks, so you are giving up better ads and feel for these build perks.

This sniper has some interesting rolls. With KC and MKC it can get ohk body shots, and Vorpal makes it one of the ways to counter a behemoth super. However, these all roll in the same slot as the handling perks, so you are giving up better ads and feel for these build perks.

With the change to precision fusions in S16, Adaptives have risen in strength. Normally killing in 5 bolts at 6 resilience and below, High Impact Reserves or a charge time increase can make it 5 bolt all resilience and 9 resilience respectively. Then it’s a matter of improving the recoil direction to be as vertical as possible and getting as much stability and accuracy as you can. This is an excellent PvP fusion if you can just get a good roll on it.

With the change to precision fusions in S16, Adaptives have risen in strength. This is an excellent PvP fusion if you can just get a good roll on it.

A 120 handcannon which you can tailor to your liking. The extensive perk pool allows one to tailor this handcannon to your liking. Personally I would go for a Slideshot + Explosive Payload roll, as Igneous Hammer does the neutral game better. Fluted Barrel and Steady Rounds help make up for the poor base stats, and Slideshot and Explosive Payload extend the range and improve the gun even more.

The medium zoom scopes add +3 / 4 to zoom which has a massive impact on damage drop off. Model 8 Red pushes it to 17 zoom which makes this the best in slot SMG by a long shot (get it? Because it has more range?) pushing a 60 stat SMG to 20M base range.

The medium zoom scopes add +3 / 4 to zoom which has a massive impact on damage drop off. Model 8 Red pushes it to 17 zoom which makes this the best in slot SMG by a long shot (get it? Because it has more range?) pushing a 60 stat SMG to 20M base range. Deciding between Kill Clip and Iron Reach comes down to deciding what you want your smg to be. Iron Reach gives it an extra 3m of range (and with smgs, every metre counts) making it a better dueling weapon, while Kill Clip’s damage buff gives it a nutty ttk and an excellent snowball machine.

The best PvP energy 140 handcannon, hands down. A high range roll with some points into stability is excellent, though if you managed to keep a Bottomless Grief + HIR roll then the 2c1b is nothing to scoff at. With how good Pally’s bases stats are, it would be worth putting some points into stability. It’s so close at base to get the sweet spot of 65-70 stab for a well balanced roll.

Really, only vorpal matters, then I would prioritize handling and recoil direction. Base range 71M (64 range stat) max range 76.6M (86 range stat) 81.8M+ maxed stat (86 stat and Killing Wind Active).

Able to roll both ALH + LI and FP + CC allows two different builds for this gun. ALH + LI gives an excellent swap weapon with tracking, while FP + CC allows the best build to be paired with a Ghorn. This gun comes with the upside of tracking, while dealing the least damage of all the rocket archetypes. If you struggle to hit your rockets on moving targets, this rocket might be for you.
Desperado returns on High Impact pulses, bringing with it the 0.4 second ttk. This is the best primary ttk in the game outside of a few select exotics or combos. GET THIS GUN WITH DESPERADO.
PvP: It’s a sword in PvP.

Which perks you choose for Salvagers Salvo in PvE is down to the situation. Chain Reaction for add clear and Vorpal for boss damage. Chosing between Demo and Ambitious Assassin is more difficult, as both are pretty good for add clear - but Demo is the clear winner for Boss damage.

Which perks you choose for Salvagers Salvo in PvE is down to the situation. Chain Reaction for add clear and Vorpal for boss damage. Chosing between Demo and Ambitious Assassin is more difficult, as both are pretty good for add clear - but Demo is the clear winner for Boss damage.
